Html:
Hi!


Do you know any real world  large, robust projects that built with TypeScript?

I want to convince the management of the company I work for to use TypeScript as our new company "standard" 

 

Thank you!

Just in case you are still looking for information about this, I'm just finishing off migrating our HTML5 game engine runtime to TypeScript. The library is in the region of 100,000 lines.

http://hardcodeded.blogspot.jp/2013/02/mostly-painlessly-migrating-3d-game.html

Good luck persuading management. Hope this helps.

I wrote one that's pretty "out there" as far as sanity is concerned: http://pratphall.org. It actually hacks on the TypeScript compiler to spit out PHP instead, it really simplifies my PHP development.

We just launched Zudio, a web-based management tool for Windows Azure Storage ( https://zud.io/ )

It's all TypeScript, using AngularJS and a couple of other libraries with the definition files from Boris's DefinitelyType project.

The development process has been so much easier thanks to TypeScript's IntelliSense and compilation and type-checking.

I've been working on this site in my spare time for the past few months. Its a SPA and written entirely in TypeScript.

http://www.nouvosoft.com
You are welcome to add your projects to https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/typescript-directory

Hi,

We just launched http://www.hittahem.se/ which is 100% typecsript using knockout.js, jquery and a couple of other libraries. The site is a real estate site, aggregating content from all major real estate sites i sweden.

I am working on mmorpg in typescript :)

https://github.com/Kikaimaru/GrindFest

Yesterday there was published new framework https://github.com/BBGONE/jRIAppTS
the client part was written in typescript.
It makes possible to create data centric HTML5 applications in the strongly typed way.
The data binding style is close to Microsoft's Silverlight and WPF style.
The data service can generate strongly type DbSets, Entities, DbContext in typescript.
You can have lookups, autocompletes, dataform, datagrid out of the box.
Or you can remove those modules from the framework and use this curtailed version like you use knockout.js.

A Leap Motion library written in TypeScript: https://github.com/logotype/LeapMotionTS
www.leapmotion.com

We launched FeatureMap recently, a new web application for product management.
The client side is written entirely in TypeScript and makes extensive use of Knockout, Backbone and jQuery. I must say I'm very pleased with TypeScript this far. :)
